inscription: Lid verso: 淵淵　十三代休雪; red artist's seal: 雪. Lid recto: 薬師寺東塔基壇土　不走庵　三輪窯;　十三代三輪休雪 written on the paper with red artist's seal: 雪
medium: Hagi ware, glazed stoneware (soil from the East Pagoda of Yakushi-ji Temple, Nara)
text: Miwa Kazuhiko is now the 13th in his family, after his father and brother, to assume the name Kyūsetsu. Yet Kazuhiko deviated in one way from the family tradition, by studying in San Francisco, where he pursued greater artistic freedom. In his works, he sometimes uses gold embellishments, a dramatic contrast to the typical creamy white Hagi glaze.
title: Abyss tea bowl
